DKI Lipatgandakan Panjang Jalur Sepeda Tahun 2020, Anggarannya?
02 Nov 2019, 06:23 by Taufiq Siddiq, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Dinas Perhubungan DKI menambah rencana pembangunan jalur sepeda tahun depan menjadi sepanjang 200 km dari awal perencanaan cuma 49 km.
"Jalur sepeda dan kita harapkan tahun depan ada sekitar 200 km jalur sepeda tambahan," ujar Kepala Dinas Perhubungan DKI, Syafrin Liputo saat ditemui di Kawasan Sudirman Jakarta Pusat, Sabtu 2 November 2019.
Syafrin menyebutkan awal perencanaan DKI bakal membangun 49 km jalur sepeda dengan konsep seluruh jalur dicat dengan marka hijau. Namun kata dia, dinas melakukan penyesuaian marka hijau dipasang di 3 km per 5 km jalur.
Menurut Syafrin dengan konsep 3-5 tersebut target awal Dinas Perhubungan yang awalnya 49 km bisa menjadi 200 km. Namun untuk lokasi pembangunan jalur sepeda Syafrin belum memberikan detailnya.
Syafrin menambahkan untuk pembangunan sepeda juga bakal direvisi dalam KUA PPAS 2020 untuk menjadi kegiatan tersendiri. Awalnya Dinas Perhubungan memasukan pembangunan jalur sepeda dalam kegiatan pemeliharaan sarana lalu lintas koridor busway.
Syafrin menyebutkan meski ada penambahan target pembangunan jalur sepeda menjadi 200 km, namun anggaran yang diajukan oleh Dinas Perhubungan tetap senilai yang direncanakan untuk 49 km yaitu Rp 62 miliar.
Dalam rapat komisi B DPRD Dinas Perhubungan DKI menyampaikan adanya penambahan anggaran jalur sepeda yang awalnya Rp 4,4 miliar. Saat itu Syafrin menyampaikan bahwa penambahan itu karena pembangunan jalur sepeda masuk dalam program prioritas Dinas Perhubungan tahun depan.

DKI Double the length of bicycle lanes in 2020, the budget?
02 Nov 2019, 06:23 by Taufiq Siddiq, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Jakarta Transportation Agency has increased its plan to build a bicycle lane next year to 200 km from the initial plan of only 49 km.
"The bicycle lane and we hope next year there will be about 200 km of additional bicycle lanes," said Head of the Jakarta Transportation Agency, Syafrin Liputo when met in the Central Jakarta Sudirman Region, Saturday 2 November 2019.
Syafrin said that the initial planning of DKI would be to build 49 km of bicycle lanes with the concept that all lanes were painted with green markers. But he said, the service made adjustments to the green markers installed at 3 km per 5 km lane.
According to Syafrin with the 3-5 concept, the Transportation Department's initial target, which was originally 49 km, could be 200 km. But for the location of the Syafrin bicycle lane development, it has not provided details.
Syafrin added that bicycle development will also be revised in KUA PPAS 2020 to become a separate activity. Initially the Transportation Office included the construction of bicycle lanes in the maintenance of busway corridor traffic facilities.
Syafrin said that although there was an increase in the target target for the construction of the bicycle lane to 200 km, the budget submitted by the Transportation Department remained worth the planned 49 km of Rp 62 billion.
In the Commission B meeting of the DKI Jakarta Transportation Department DPRD, there was an increase in the budget for the bicycle lane, which was originally Rp4.4 billion. At that time Syafrin said that the addition was due to the construction of bicycle lanes included in the Transportation Department's priority program next year.
